[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The STEWARDS defines requirements for managing agricultural water quality and quantity data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: STEWARDS enables efficient data collection, visualization, and analysis for conservation planning.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: STEWARDS integrates with sensors, databases, and analysis tools via APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: STEWARDS provides dashboards for managing and visualizing agricultural data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: STEWARDS runs on modern devices with internet connectivity.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: STEWARDS interacts with GIS tools and SQL-based systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: STEWARDS supports secure data transmission via HTTP/HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: STEWARDS optimizes memory usage for processing agricultural datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: STEWARDS supports data uploads, queries, and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: STEWARDS is customizable for various agricultural research needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: STEWARDS integrates with cloud storage and analytics services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: STEWARDS enables data collection, management, and real-time analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: STEWARDS is designed for researchers, policymakers, and agricultural managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: STEWARDS requires stable internet and supported hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: STEWARDS assumes compatibility with GIS tools and cloud services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Entity: A core object representing agricultural data.
Visualization: Graphical representation of data trends.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall connect to external databases via APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide dashboards for data visualization and management.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall collect and centralize agricultural data from multiple sources (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate visualizations for trend analysis (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable users to query data using predefined filters (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall send alerts for abnormal data trends (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive controls for data exploration and management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process data queries promptly.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support concurrent access by up to about a hundred users without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store data records for a minimum of several years.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall support automated data backups and restoration.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with open standards for interoperability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO standards for data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain nearly always uptime.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: User actions shall receive feedback instantly (REQ-USAB-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate data collection, queries, and visualizations.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API guides, and configuration examples.
[SEC] 5. References: STEWARDS Technical Guide, GIS Integration Manual, and ISO Standards.
